In the Karakoram and Himalayas, debris cover on glaciers produces a spatial variation in glacier fluctuations
11 . Moreover, the sensitivity of a glacier to changing climate depends on the glacier’s present environment, specifically, the environmental control on the heat and mass balances of glaciers
12– 17 . For instance, glaciers in an arid environment require relatively colder conditions and tend to be less sensitive to temperature change than those in a warm and humid climate
12– 15 . In addition, the seasonality of precipitation, which varies widely over the HMA region, will affect the mass-balance sensitivity of glaciers
16– 20 . These studies suggest that glaciers can undergo different mass changes even under uniform climate change.
